column4: Hi there, I've been looking around at laptops and I'm hoping to find a cheap option that is perfect for Ubuntu.. wondering if anyone is using a laptop with Ubuntu and if they could suggest one I should look at.
It'll just be a internet/blogging laptop so I could go for a cheap option
I had a dell for while, things worked well
Kinda old, we're talking three years or so.
It's that or a used mac, just not interesting in a Windows laptop.
I've been very happy with my $600us gateway mt64xx
ati graphics though. Don't expect blazing 3d
line in is for a mike, or recording off another player of some kind
copy the ttf file to /usr/share/fonts/truetype , or create ~/.fonts and put it there
read back, I told you how
restart gimp, it should find it. If not, run   fc-cache  in a terminal
did you ever run alacarte with sudo?
ok, don't do that :)    do   sudo chown -R patrick:patrick ~/.local
when you use sudo, it writes configs to your home dir as root owned, so you are not able to edit them thereafter
if you're trying to check a submenu, check an item inside the submenu
after a failed login attempt, check the contents of ~/.xsession-errors and /var/log/Xorg.0.log (read them from ctl-alt-f1, ctl-alt-f2 to get back to gui)
